text: Evem thought I m feeling ok now  I m worried that one day I will give up I don t know if this is appropriate but I need to write this down I ve felt suicidal many times before and have made some  feeble  attempts in the past  I ve not felt seriously suicidal for a long while but I ve been thinking a lot over the last few days Have any of you mourned the loss of Scott Hutchinson from Frightened Rabbit  It s hit me quite hard  Not necessarily because of a love for their music but just because  here s another person who has battled mental health problems for a long time  and has reached his  s and lost it It s just been making me think a lot about whether that will be me  I know you can t predict the future and I should try not to think like that but I m just so scared that things will get worse and worse and then it ll just be too much and I will follow that path  It s a feeling I ve not properly had before  I ve dealt with actively feeling suicidal but I think right now I m confronting my mental health problems as a potential lifelong condition that could have suicide as a future outcome I might not be explaining myself right  And I know there are people on this sub who need more immediate help but these thoughts are really upsetting me and I wondered if anyone here could relate  It all just feels very real and the though of potentially getting happier but then shit just falling apart feels scarier to me than anything else  Maybe that s a good sign  Maybe that means I want to be alive and I m scared that my brain s going to mess that up one day in the future  I just feel very unsettled Peace to all of you x
summary: Scott Hutchinson from Frightened Rabbit passed away. Evem is worried about her mental health problems and wants to know if anyone mourned the loss of Scott Hutchinson. She is worried that one day she will be like Scott Hutchinson and give up.
cleaned: scott hutchinson frightened rabbit pass away worried mental health problem want know mourn loss scott hutchinson worried day like scott hutchinson

text: Appreciation for suicide hotline operatorsI have been violently depressed for a month or so now  these times come and go amid a general depression that started a long time ago  I talked with two good operators lately  thank you to them  They tried to understand what I was saying  and even when they didn t quite get it  I could tell they were trying  And I could tell they were trying to not judge me  They re human  they can only try  and they work an emotionally taxing job  especially on the nightshift  Whenever I m unreasonably bad  at those times talking with an operator is a chance to practice being decent to somebody  It can return me to my senses  restore my empathy  I m also so lonely so I appreciate the conversation  So thank you to all hotline workers lt
summary: Suicide hotline operators have helped me get better after being depressed for a month or so. They tried to understand what I was saying and even when they didn't quite get it, they were trying not to judge me. They work an emotionally taxing job especially on the nightshift.
